column2: OREGON DRIVER'S LICENSE TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text
column10: Answer4 Text

column2: 1. If a driver follows you too closely, you should:
column6: move to another lane if possible.
column8: increase your speed as you are probably driving too slowly.
column10: activate your stop lights.

column2: 2. The octagonal shape is used:
column4: to warn drivers of existing or possible hazards on roadways.
column8: for stop signs and railroad advance warning signs.
column10: exclusively for stop signs.

column2: 3. This road sign means:
column8: You can travel in either direction in this lane
column10: Two-way traffic ahead

column2: 4. A flashing yellow traffic signal means:
column4: Slow down and be alert at the upcoming intersection.
column8: The same thing as a stop sign.
column10: Stop and proceed when a green light appears.

column2: 5. When approaching a curve, remember to:
column4: accelerate slightly before entering the curve.
column6: drive at the posted speed limit throughout the curve.
column8: drive at the posted speed limit as you enter the curve, then slow down gradually.
column10: slow down before entering the curve.

column2: 6. You are entering a roadway from a private road, and you need to turn left. You have to yield to:
column8: pedestrians only.
column10: vehicles from both directions.

column2: 7. To avoid being in a truck driver’s blind spot, you should:
column4: never pass the truck and put your headlights on.
column8: flash your lights.
column10: avoid driving on either side of the truck and don’t tailgate.

column2: 8. On what three conditions does your blood alcohol content (BAC) depend?
column4: Your height. How much alcohol you drink. The type of beverage you drink.
column6: Your weight. How much alcohol you drink. How much time passes between drinks.
column8: How fit you are. How much alcohol you drink. Your height.
column10: Your weight. The type of beverage you drink. How fit you are.

column2: 9. To check your blind spot before changing lanes:
column4: look into the left side mirror.
column8: look over your shoulder in the direction you plan to move.
column10: look into the right side mirror.

column2: 10. A steady yellow light means that a ______ light will soon appear.
column8: flashing green
column10: flashing yellow

column2: 11. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they can not safely return to the right lane before any oncoming vehicle comes within 200 feet of them.
column6: they approach a curve on a two-way road and can not see around it.
column8: their lane has a solid yellow center line.
column10: All of the above.

column2: 12. This sign warns drivers that:
column6: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.
column8: there is an intersection ahead.
column10: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.

column2: 13. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: another traffic lane joins the one they are on.
column6: another road enters the highway from the direction shown.
column8: left turns are not allowed at the intersection.
column10: the road will make a sharp turn to the right.

column2: 14. This sign means drivers should:
column4: proceed at normal speed through the upcoming intersection.
column6: come to a complete stop and check for oncoming traffic before proceeding.
column8: give the right-of-way to traffic on the road they wish to enter.
column10: not drive in this lane.

column2: 15. This road sign means:
column8: Mountain trail
column10: Flagger ahead

column2: 16. When driving in fog, drivers should:
column8: use low beam headlights to better illuminate the road ahead.
column10: All of the above.

column2: 17. Emergency vehicles:
column4: have the right-of-way when using siren and red/blue lights.
column8: may use a loudspeaker to give instructions.
column10: All of the above.

column2: 18. What does a flashing yellow light mean?
column6: Drivers may move forward with caution.
column8: The same thing as a stop sign.
column10: All of the above.

column2: 19. What is the purpose of minimum speed limits?
column4: To allow emergency vehicles with red flashing lights to safely pass other vehicles.
column6: To keep a smooth traffic flow.
column8: To halt the traffic flow.
column10: To decrease the state average speed statistic.

column2: 20. If you stop along the road at night:
column6: turn on your emergency flashers and leave your low beams on.
column8: turn on your headlights only.
column10: turn off your emergency lights and leave your high beams on.

column2: 21. What should drivers do when they see this road sign?
column6: come to a complete stop and wait for a train to cross.
column8: increase their speed to cross the intersection before a train arrives.
column10: slow down, look for a train, and be prepared to stop.

column2: 22. This road sign means:
column8: Stop sign ahead
column10: Keep to the side indicated by the arrow

column2: 23. Following another vehicle too closely is known as:
column8: speedgating.
column10: closetailing.

column2: 24. A pedestrian in the crosswalk when the 'DON’T WALK' signal begins flashing must:
column8: finish crossing the street.
column10: go back and wait the “WALK” light

column2: 25. Drivers under 21 years of age are considered to be driving under the influence if their blood alcohol concentration (BAC) is:
column8: .05% or higher.
column10: .08% or higher.

column2: 26. If the entrance lane is too short to allow acceleration to expressway speed, you should:
column4: enter the expressway and accelerate quickly.
column6: accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.
column8: reduce your speed to 15 MPH or less and blend with traffic.
column10: stop and wait for a large space in traffic.

column2: 27. As you drive on the expressway, make sure:
column6: your directional signal goes off before you change lanes.
column8: you cut off vehicles behind you when you change lanes.
column10: All of the above.

column2: 28. If you miss your exit from an interstate expressway, you should:
column4: go to the next exit and come back to the exit you missed.
column6: make a quick U-turn from your lane of travel.
column8: use the right turn signal, check your mirrors and move to the right.
column10: pull over to the right and back up with caution until you reach the exit ramp.

column2: 29. After parking, are you allowed to open a door on the road side of your vehicle?
column6: Yes, but only if it does not interfere with bicyclists and other traffic.
column8: No, never.
column10: Yes, but only if oncoming vehicles or bicycles are at least 10 feet away.

column2: 30. When you make a left turn from a one-way road into a two-way road, you must:
column4: enter the two-way road to the right of its center line.
column6: enter the two-way road to the left of its center line.
column8: make a U-turn into the two-way road.
column10: turn left into the one-way road.

column2: 31. Drivers must be prepared for anything coming up in the road ahead. They should:
column4: maintain focus toward the left of the road.
column6: drive with the right foot resting lightly on the brake pedal.
column8: scan the road for traffic conditions and possible hazards.
column10: stare straight ahead at all times.

column2: 32. This sign means:
column8: Right turns not allowed.
column10: Warning: U-turn ahead.

column2: 33. When the road is slippery, you should:
column8: press your brakes in slow, steady strokes.
column10: use your emergency or parking brake.

column2: 34. When a traffic signal light turns green, you should:
column8: back up slowly.
column10: yield the right-of-way to larger vehicles.

column2: 35. When two cars arrive at an intersection with no signs or signals at the same time, which car has the right-of-way?
column4: The car that is traveling faster.
column6: The car in which the driver sounds the horn.
column8: The car approaching from the left.
column10: The car approaching from the right.
